column4: I am trying to install Ubuntu 9.10 X64.  However, when I get to step 4, neither of my 2 disks appears in the partitioner.  How can I continue installing?
Are they set up in raid?
They might not be supported, they might require drivers, you could see if the alternate cd has drivers for your drives
Do a sudo fdisk -l in terminal
Ok so go to Computer and make sure you can access all the drives and that they are all mounted
the disk 1 with Windows 7 RC on it mounts just fine
the other disk has nothing on it, and i dont think it will mount
Oh right it should mount ok, what type is it?
even if i format disk 2 to something like NTFS, the installer still doesnt see it
the installer doesnt show either drive, or any partitions at all
Hmm weird, is this thee first time you have encountered the problem?
last time i installed ubuntu i didnt have this exact problem
when i had more drives hooked up, it always wanted to install to the largest hard drive
but that isnt the problem this time
Erm well you could try restarting, other than that i really don't know
I have multiple times ... even unhooked the Windows 7 RC disk
